Topic: Cult Figures in the Americas
The course will explore our fascination with cult figures, cult texts, cult films, understanding their religious undertones within the secular and critical context of modernity. For Latin American societies, and for the democratic project born with the independence from the British monarchy, this study acquires particular importance as we consider populism, figures of political charisma and the media saturated environment in which we live. Particular attention will be paid to political figures such as Eva Perón, Ché Guevara, John F. Kennedy, and others.
Particulars: Two papers, 1 midterm, textual commentaries, and oral reports.
course_description: An introduction to different methods of literary criticism and textual interpretation, applying a variety of theoretical approaches to selected literary texts.  Readings include essays, fiction, poetry, and drama. *Note: This course is non-repeatable.
